body_html:
@pjh5,
I just did that.
I am getting a different error message.

[enforce fail at context_gpu.h:155] . Encountered CUDA error: no kernel image is available for execution on the device Error from operator:
output: "LSTM/i2h_w" name: "" type: "XavierFill" arg { name: "shape" ints: 400 ints: 91 } device_option { device_type: 1 cuda_gpu_id: 0 }

??

The files: caffe2_pybind11_state.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so and caffe2_pybind11_state_gpu.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so are dated April 8th

Shouldn't they be of today's date (assuming they get recompiled)?

body:
@pjh5,
I just did that.
I am getting a different error message.

[enforce fail at context_gpu.h:155] . Encountered CUDA error: no kernel image is available for execution on the device Error from operator: 
output: "LSTM/i2h_w" name: "" type: "XavierFill" arg { name: "shape" ints: 400 ints: 91 } device_option { device_type: 1 cuda_gpu_id: 0 }

??

The files: **caffe2_pybind11_state.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so** and **caffe2_pybind11_state_gpu.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so**  are dated **April 8th**

Shouldn't they be of today's date (assuming they get recompiled)?
